alert.note: Alert for Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Otero, southeastern Dona Ana and north central El Paso Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 357 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chaparral, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northeast El Paso, Chaparral, Anthony Gap and Franklin Mountains State Park. This includes Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
